item.title: Maternity | “Independent Entity” studies license increase
item.description:
The government has been responsible for a “third independent entity” of elaborating a study on increasing maternity leave and annual holidays. In five months, Dsal made almost 900 inspections of combating illegal work, which resulted in the punishment of only three employer entities
The Secretary for Economics and Finance, Tai Kin IP, had already indicated that the government was working to adjust the number of maternity leave and annual holidays in a plenary session of the Legislative Assembly. The acceleration of the process was confirmed by the Director of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), Chan Un Tong, who revealed that the government has commissioned a third independent entity to proceed with an inquiry and study on the increase in labor standards, namely the issue of maternity leave, currently fixed in 70 days, and vacation. The Macao Law establishes the annual vacation number paid in six days, a rule that has not changed for four decades and many companies have ignored more generous contracts for workers. Public officials enjoy 22 days of paid vacation. However, the director of Dsal stresses the need to “reach consensus between the parts of employers and workers”, through the Permanent Council for Social Concertation (CPCs). To this end, “considering that the revision of labor legislation involves several social factors”, the executive emphasizes that it is necessary to “consider the general interests of Macao” and make a public consultation. The point of situation on the reform of labor laws was advanced by the director of Dsal in response to a written interpellation of Leong Hong Sai. A lot One of the unavoidable themes when it comes to market and labor laws in Macau is the issue of non-resident workers (TNR). The residents' deputy did not let the opportunity to request the improvement of the inspection to irregularities involving TNR. In this respect, Chan Un Tong indicated that between January and May this year, DSAL made a total of 874 inspections, which resulted in the application of administrative sanctions to 856 people due to illegal work "(including" exercise of duties in place/ to employer different from authorized "," exercise of alien to authorized functions ", illegal worker and work on their own)". However, despite the nearly 900 inspections made, only three employing entities were “punished with ancillary sanctions”, such as the revocation of contracting authorizations regarding 10 non-resident workers. The three employers were also prevented for six months from requesting new TNR hiring authorizations. The issue of “voluntary overtime” and the right to rest was also mentioned. The director of DSAL recalled that the law defines that the normal working period cannot exceed 48 hours per week, with this number of hours only the maximum weekly limit of the normal working period. However, the law opens the hypothesis of agreement between employer and worker for length of service, "the employer should assure the worker 10 consecutive hours of rest per day, in a total of not less than 12 hours."

item.title: Female
item.description:
Recently, news that circulated online, reported that the “mutual help society to the co-babling of women” in the UK, headquartered in London, had received more than 50 women all in their 50s. Mutual aid society only receives women who are alone. It is an exclusive space reserved only for women, where men have no place. The goal is to provide these women a space where they can live independently, to help each other and live with dignity and autonomy, in a more advanced phase of life. These exclusive spaces are apartments that can have one, two or three bedrooms, properties of the mutual help society. The highest price of a 3 bedroom apartment is £ 400,000, about $ 4.2 million from Hong Kong (HKD). Women can buy them according to their financial abilities. Mutual care include financial management and domestic group maintenance, etc. Women can participate in different groups depending on their interests and their skills that put the service of collective life. For example, the group may be in charge of hiring staff to deliver meals to sick women and take care of those who are no longer self-sufficient. If group members are unable to perform these tasks on their own they can ask other residents for help. A lady who lives in the mutual help society said that this model gave him the courage to face aging. The reason for the emergence of mutual aid societies for the co-bibing of women is that they stop working earlier to take care of their children and family and their economic condition and the social circle are more limited. But even more significant is the greatest female longevity. If you live alone at an advanced age, your situation deserves more attention. Guardian announced that since 1997, 1 in 6 British has been over 65 years old. From 2017, this percentage increased to 1 in 5 and it is estimated that in 2037, out of 4 British 1 will be over 65 years old. This trend reflects the aging of the British population. In Japan, more than 76,000 people living alone die at home unaccompanied and more than 21,000 are only discovered 8 days after death. Therefore, a place where a group of older people live together can avoid loneliness and the possibility of dying alone. In the society of our day, there is a tendency to live alone. One of the attractions of this situation is the decrease in the financial burden. Those who live in a family have more expenses and still have to take care of their parents. Singles have a more reliable life. As mentioned above, the price of a three -bedroom mutual help society apartment around 4.2 million HKD, which can represent an affordable amount. Another advantage of being single is the freedom that you enjoy. Of course this freedom implies abdicating a family life, the possibility of having romantic relationships and children. The traditional Chinese concept of “raising children to ensure old age and storing grain to avoid hunger” (養兒防老 ， 積穀防飢) cannot be applied to singles. Should we choose to be single or should we organize a family life with children? There is no single answer to this question. It depends on how individuals weigh the pros and cons of various aspects of their preferences before making a decision. In either case, we should think carefully before opting. Despite everything, this decision will affect our whole life. If after 40, a woman wants to suddenly found a family and being a mother may have difficulty reaching this goal. When a person reaches the initial phase of aging, he can still move freely and have full use of his mental abilities, so living in a mutual aid society does not represent any problem. As age advances, physical condition is gradually deteriorated, intellectual abilities begin to slow down and diseases reduce mobility and communication capacity. For example, the elderly with Alzheimer's need to have professional care. Are these professionals present in mutual help societies to solve these problems? There is no detailed information on the subject. However, to ensure appropriate care for the elderly is more appropriate than being provided by professionals. For mutual aid societies to work in full, they must pay close attention to this subject. Should we, as a society, foster the appearance of more mutual help societies to widen these services to more people? To answer the question, we must try to understand social needs and carefully analyze whether there is any overlap in the roles of mutual aid societies and the elderly service agencies. A decision that can only be made after further research.

According to an official note about the event, this exhibition is held in partnership with Artdeport and presents the work of the well-known Chinese contemporary artist. This is one of the "collateral exhibitions" of the Biennial, which has as its theme "Hey, what brings it here?", Exploring the ideas of "seeing, enjoying and embracing the luck of art that transforms the chaos of life in a significant way." According to the same note, the artist “is known for his philosophical depth and innovative vision”, and the collections and exhibitions he has made throughout Asia “are observations of daily life with existential contemplation, showing Zhang's characteristic fusion between visual brilliance and intellectual resonance to present luck as a significant human experience”. There According to the official page of “Art Macao”, Zhang Zhanzhan believes that “luck is not a fortuitous gift, but a disposition of mind marked by a keen conscience, an active search and a sincere welcome in daily life.” Thus, the works present in the HWA Gallery “captures fragments of time, guiding him to 'see luck'-the subtle brightness in the morning fog”, or to “grasp luck”, exploring the idea of a “flying in fleeting meetings”, or to “embrace luck”, in which the public can, by visualizing the artistic work, “intertwining the warmth of life with the world”. Thus, in this exhibition, "art serves as a flashlight, illuminating the meaning in chaos and together exploring the true essence of luck." Zhang Zhanzhan was born in Hebei in 1982, having graduated from the Nanjing University School of Arts of Arts in 2008. One of the latest exhibitions he held was in 2023, named “Out of This World,” patent at the Yinchuan Museum of Contemporary Art. The previous year, the artist debuted "Post Me Generation: How to Write About Young Artists" in Beijing. Last year, and also in Beijing, Zhang Zhanzhan held “You’re Always on My Mind” at Beijing's well -known Art District.

item.title: FRC | Timor-Leste images exhibited until August
item.description:
It is called “a trip to the land of crocodile in the year of the serpent” and is the new exhibition of photography in the Rui Cunha Foundation, by Cristiana Figueiredo. The images are added to Bibi Ain's texts. There are 25 photographs of “people, places and things”, on a trip full of emotions
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) inaugurates today, from 6.30 pm, a photographic exhibition about Timor-Leste entitled “A Trip to the Land of Crocodile in the year of the serpent”, with images by Cristiana Figueiredo and texts by Bibi Ain. This initiative "results from a trip of discovery, for one, and from reunion to the other at the beginning of this year." With the subtitle “People. Places. Things”, the show includes 25 photographs that visually reveal what texts describe about the emotions impregnated in the small details of the journey. According to the authors, cited by a FRC note, "at the beginning of 2025 we embarked on a trip to Timor-Leste," was "the discovery of home roots, the hug of the loved ones, the reappearance of sweet and fragile memories," or "enter a history book and feel the welcome of the unknown." "The trip was an intimate and inspiring lounge in Timor-Leste, where seemingly disparate perspectives came together to create new perspectives, about the people and places of this wonderful small country," reveals the pair of travelers in his manifesto. Cristiana Figueiredo further states that "behind the lens, I witnessed the transformation of timid behaviors into generous smiles that revealed intimate glimpses and fleeting ”. Stories and Images The author says she found, on this trip, "a landscape that surrendered to the capture of the window of a moving car on a bumpy road, or a quiet moment with her feet buried in the hot sand, caressed by the sound of waves to beat." Thus, “sharing this unforgettable experience through the photographs of this exhibition is my love letter to Timor-Leste,” he said. Cristiana Figueiredo's life is a tapestry woven on three continents, according to her biography. “Born in Angola, his years of formation in Portugal passed. In the quiet afternoons after school, the parents' art encyclopedias aroused his passion for the arts, an early fascination that inspired her to take several short courses in the history of art, design and painting, and to devote himself to photography, throwing the foundations for her creative path,” he reads. Upon completion of the degree in Sociology at the University of Porto, Cristiana's life took her to Macau, where, in the last 23 years, she was a local entrepreneur in the food and drinks, having become her creativity to graphic design, branding and interior design. Recently, Cristiana has become full-time visual creator, exploring various means, continually capturing the world around her and reimaginating it through her lenses, brushes and computer. Everywhere In turn, Bibi Ain's life is a woven tapestry between three countries: Timor-Leste, Australia and China. Born in Timor-Leste, he spent his years of formation in Australia. Studied Art, History of Art, Cinema and Television, English and Italian literature, architecture, business management and, finally, tourist management. It served your country as a diplomat in the last thirty years. Bibi Ain, stage name, derives from the word tetum “bibi” (goat) and “ain” (foot). “Like a goat who jumps everywhere with enthusiasm in search of a new adventure, my family dubbed me to reflect my thirst to travel,” he explains in the same note. The images and texts will be exposed until August 2, 2025.

item.title: Lisbon | Vítor Marreiros protagoniza shows “Camões five zero zero”
item.description:
Vítor Hugo Marreiros presents from next Saturday an exhibition in Lisbon at Galeria Passavite. It is “Camões five zero zero”, which celebrates the 500th anniversary of the birth of the one who is considered the largest poet in the Portuguese language
It's called “Camões five zero zero” and, more than being the name of Vítor Hugo Marreiros's new exhibition, is an initiative that shows the work of the artist and designer Macaense in Portugal. The inauguration takes place in downtown Lisbon, at the Galeria Passavite, next Saturday from 18:30. The exhibition that will be evident in this space until August 30. According to a press release, the show “marks the 500th anniversary of the birth of Luís de Camões”, starting from an original idea by graphic designer Henrique Silva, better known as Bibra, who has lived in Macao for many years. Thus, what is done in “Camões five zero zero” is a “contemporary and symbolic reading of the poet's figure through the posters Victor Marreiros has created over three decades to mark June 10 in Macao”. In this exhibition, Camões “from the usual context” is removed, the image of the poet with new interpretations mirrored in “graphic freedom, humor and critical spirit, in a series that is, simultaneously, memory and creation”. An unprecedented show The exhibition arrives in Lisbon thanks to the support of IPOR - Portuguese Institute of the East and Herdade do Perdigão. This is the first time Vitor Hugo Marreiros exposes his work in Portugal. It should be noted that Camões is a constant presence in one of the works by which Marreiros has been better known in recent times: the June 10 posters promoted by the House of Portugal in Macau and which are designed by themselves, in a constant mix of elements that refer to Portuguese. Vítor Hugo Marreiros has a career of over 45 years dedicated to the visual arts, scenography and graphic design, which was internationally recognized with more than 200 awards and distinctions. The artist and designer was born in Macao in 1960, and is a founding member of the CAC - Circle of Macao Culture Friends and also the Macao Design Association. Studied, in the 1980s, at the Higher School of Fine Arts of Porto, subsidized by the Cultural Institute, which later worked for several years. It won, from the hands of the government of Macao, still in the years of the Portuguese Administration, the professional merit medal on October 5, 1999. During the exhibition will be available a special edition of screen printing, numbered and signed by the artist, as well as the catalog of the show.

item.title: Financial Reserve | Balance exceeds 640 billion
item.description:
Last May, the Balance of the MSAR Financial Reserve reached the 640.5 billion Patacas. Since the beginning of the year, the financial reserve has grown 24.2 billion patacas. In May alone, the increase was about 8 billion
The balance of the Macao Financial Reserve arrived at the end of May to 640.5 billion Patacas, according to data shared yesterday in the official bulletin by Macao Monetary Authorities (AMCM). In the first five months of this year, the reserve grew 24.2 billion patacas, with May to “contribute” about 8 billion patacas, exceeding the trend in April, with a monthly growth of 1.2 percent. According to the balance published yesterday by AMCM, the reserve has been at the highest level since December 2021, when it reached 643.2 billion patacas. Still, it remains far from the historical record of 663.6 billion patacas, hit in late February 2021, although the territory is in the middle of COVID-19 pandemic. It is recalled that the reserve had registered in 2024 the best year since the covid-19 pandemic, after earning 35.7 billion patacas, the highest annual increase since 2019, when the value of the reserve increased by 70.6 billion patacas. AMCM data also reveal that between January and May this year, the financial reserve investments yielded 16.7 billion patacas in revenues. In late May, the value of the extraordinary reserve was set at 459.65 billion patacas, while the basic reserve registered 164.2 billion patacas. Backdrop The initial budget of the territory for 2025 foresees a 7 percent increase in total expenses, to 109.4 billion patacas. However, the Legislative Assembly approved in the specialty on July 9 the amendment to the budget, which included an extra increase of 2.86 billion of the expenses. Macao's Financial Reserve is mostly composed of 265.5 billion Patacas in subcontracted investments, deposits and current accounts of 254.3 billion patacas and even credit securities in the amount of 116.6 billion Patacas. Last year, investments yielded to the financial reserve nearly 31 billion patacas, corresponding to a profitability rate of 5.3 percent, AMCM said in late February.

item.title: Chikungunya | SS reveal according to imported case
item.description: Health services (SS) registered the second imported case of chikungunya fever, which was detected in a tourist from Canton province. The occurrence was released yesterday through a statement. "The case was diagnosed with a 33-year-old tourist woman who resides in the Guangdong province of Foshan's Nanhai district. At noon on Monday, the patient entered Macao and expressed symptoms such as fever and rash. "On Tuesday, the public health laboratory confirmed the presence of the Chikungunya virus. At present, the patient is in a stable state, the individuals with whom cohabiting and traveled had no symptoms of indisposition," he was added. According to the tourist's travel history, as well as the date of symptom manifestation and the results of laboratory tests performed, the case was classified as imported instead of a place. "Health services will send personnel to inspect the source of proliferation at their place of accommodation and near the main places of activity in Macao, in order to reinforce the elimination of stagnant water in surrounding areas and organize the preventive elimination of mosquitoes, according to the situation," he was promised. According to the SS, chikungunya fever is a viral disease, transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes, especially those of Aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus species.

item.title: Economic Housing | Ma io fong wants t2 for unique residents
item.description:
The legislator linked to the Association of Women wants the government to facilitate the access of singular residents to T2 dwellings, taking into account the breach of the demand for economic housing. MA IO Fong also suggests the possibility of exchange in this segment of public housing
Deputy Ma Io Fong wants to know if the executive will authorize singular residents to acquire economic housing of T2 or higher typology. The issue is part of an interpellation of the member of the Women's Association, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. Given the low demand for economic housing, the government admitted to reviewing the program. Ma Io Fong intends to know if the review will enable the purchase of T2 houses by unique residents, which are currently only limited to T1 apartments. "Does management, in response to changes in the demand for the government's housing program, will allow the eligibility of individual applicants to apply for T2 or higher type apartments?" Asks the legislator. In the same vein, the deputy intends that the executive explains whether there is the possibility of the order of public tenders of candidacy for the purchase of economic housing to be maintained, so that the competitions do not have to repeat regularly. Other changes According to Ma Io Fong, with the reduction of demand it is anticipated that the T1 apartments can be unoccupied for a long time and never find buyers. In this scenario, the deputy intends to know if the government has plans to prevent the construction of homes of this type, to “avoid the waste of land and public resources”. Regarding changes to the economic housing regime, it asks if the government will create a mechanism that allows residents who have bought economic housing in the past to change to more recent housing. This change aims to allow families to find larger houses in order to promote the increase of the birth rate, and to counteract the aging of the population. Economic housing is one of the public housing offers, where residents with certain income levels can buy a housing at cheaper than private. Houses have quality and size limits.

item.title: CPSP | Two detainees for exploitation of prostitution
item.description: The Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) announced the arrest of two men abroad of a Cotai hotel, as evidence of the crime of exploitation of prostitution. After receiving a complaint for the harassment of people outside a hotel, CPSP sent agents to the scene and identified two men, one from the interior and one from Thailand, the latter being dressed in women's clothes. According to the newspaper or Mun, when he was approached by the authorities, the interior man confessed to raising customers for the man who dressed as a woman. For each client raised, the man could receive up to $ 500 from Hong Kong. In turn, the prostitute charged $ 1,500 to each client. When the authorities moved to the hotel used by the prostitute, they found a third interior man. He confessed to reserving his room that day. The two interior suspects were arrested and sent to the prosecutor. They are indicted for the crime of exploitation of prostitution, which can be punished with a prison sentence that can reach the three years. As for the Thailand National, he was sent to the immigration department, as he used the tourist visa to practice a profession, which is considered an abuse of the type of visa issued.

item.title: CCAC | Bribes have decreased significantly
item.description:
The commissioner against corruption has indicated that “in recent years”, situations of abuse of power and bribes have decreased significantly. The agency led by Ieong Seong points out that current cases are more violations of general duties, such as falsification of attendance records
"With the efforts made over the years, the number of typical cases of corruption in public services involving situations of abuse of power to receive bribes has decreased significantly in recent years," said the director of Administration and Public Function Services (SAFP), Leong Weng In, citing the Commissioner against Corruption (CCAC). The reduction of cases involving abuse of power and bribes is attributed to the harsh combat to the phenomenon, as well as the awareness actions carried out by CCAC to change mindsets in the civil service, is indicated in a response to the interpellation of Deputy Nick Law by the SAFP director. Leong Weng In cites CCAC in an analysis of the most frequent types of offenses these days. "Currently, cases related to public services workers are mainly related to the violation of the general duties to which they are subject, such as cases of falsification of attendance records and illegal accumulation of functions, which demonstrates that their work has achieved positive results," is indicated. Good behavior To keep up with the evolution of the type of infractions more frequently committed, CCAC has adjusted the content of awareness actions “depending on the trend”. “CCAC has continually drawing their attention also, in the context of training, to the importance of ethical conduct,” is indicated by Leong Weng In. The SAFP Director even points out that after infringements are detected, "many public services invite, by its initiative CCAC." The fight against corruption is a continuous and long -term process that has to be viewed with a pragmatic and realistic attitude so that it can be effective to respond to my trends of infringements, it is still mentioned.

item.title: Game | Seaport estimates 9% of revenues in the second half

item.title: Sport | 26 million supports for athletes and associations
item.description:
Between April and June this year, the Sport Fund assigned support of 26.1 million patacas. The most supported entity was the Macao Football Association, receiving 3.18 million Patacas
The Sport Fund distributed 26.1 million patacas on support to athletes and associations in the second quarter of the year. The data were updated on the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP). The most supported entity in the second quarter was the Macao Football Association by receiving 3.18 million patacas, which represented 12.2 percent of the total distributed supports. The soccer association also received one of the largest unit support, in this case in the amount of almost 526,000 Patacas, for the organization of football championships 7 in the U14 and U-12 categories. The second most supported entity was the Macau-China General Association of Automobile by receiving a total of 2.77 million patacas, between six subsidies to support pilots or rent facilities. Only in facilities rental costs alone, the association received 1.4 million patacas, although about 514,000 patacas still respects a rental for December last year. Also in this case, when evaluated the proportion of the supports, AAMC received more than 10 percent of the supports distributed to 55 associations. In terms of unit subsidies, the largest amount delivered to the Macau-China General Automobile Association and reached 576,000 patacas. This amount was distributed in April and again in May and was justified with the support of the participation of six local riders in proofs abroad. Gold wushu However, the highest unit support reached the amount of 1.32 million patacas and was distributed to the General Association of Wushu de Macao, with the official explanation of the second installment of the “Financial Support Plan for the Training of Elite Athletes and Teams in Internship 2025 - subsidies for elite athletes and the Wushu Internship team”. Between April and June, the Wushu Association was one of the most supported by the Sport Fund, in second place, receiving about 2.67 million Patacas, among 12 different subsidies, which represented 10.2 percent of total financial support. The second largest unit support was 813,000 patacas and was recipient by the Macau-China Dragon Boat Association. The official justification indicates that the subsidy filed the second installment of the “Financial Support Plan for the Training of Elite Athletes and Teams in Internship 2025 - Dragon Boat Elite Athletes”. In total, the Dragon Boat Association received four different subsidies that totaled 975,000 patacas, with the remaining supports to fit the organization of local evidence or participation in events abroad. The data also show that the support of the sport fund grew 3.5 million patacas compared to the same period.

He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. It is sad, but as Naipaul warned, through these stops the race is everything and is soaked in it as deeply as, elsewhere, in religion. 12/10/22 Bruno Latour, an anthropologist who studied the sciences and their procedures and legitimations, law, technique and religions died and entertained the guts to the dogmas of the "modern". And about politics said, disassessedly: «If transparency is required from the politician, we kill him; If one requires fidelity to what the other was or he says, kills him; If a mimetic relationship is required between what the crowd wants and what its representative says, the representation is killed. item.title: The yo -yo
item.description: O my friends, companions of these funerals trips to countries as old as the stars and the moon, and as strange as the profound interior of our disgraceful souls, - that startle still awaits us, what secret spells we will have to overcome, what horrors will rise to our dilated pupils of amazement and terror? Increasingly close to our precarious existences, howling the war monster, which threatens to merge humanity with the earth, incessantly traveled by the squalid spectrum of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pests. item.title: Hong Kong | Annulled ban on bathrooms for transgender people
item.description: A Hong Kong judge decided yesterday to nullify the regulations that criminalized the use of public bathrooms by transgender people according to their gender identity, considering that they violate the principle of equality. Judge Russell Coleman granted the request for judicial revision filed by K, a trans man who was born a woman, maintaining that the rules in force represent a “disproportionate and unnecessary intrusion in the rights to privacy and equality”. Despite the decision, the magistrate suspended for a year the formal annulment of regulations, giving time to the local government to decide whether to adopt a new legal framework to resolve the situation. The current legislation only allows children under the age of five, accompanied by an opposite adult, enter a bathroom for another genus. The violation of the standard is punishable by a fine of up to $ 2,000 of Hong Kong. K, diagnosed with gender dysphoria, filed a complaint in 2022, claiming that the prohibition of using male public bathrooms violated his constitutional rights by preventing him from living fully according to his gender identity. The decision represents another advance in the rights of the LGBTQ+ community in the Chinese Special Administrative Region, which has reviewed some policies after activist judicial victories. In 2023, Hong Kong's highest court ruled that the sexual sex reactive surgery should not be mandatory to change the genre in official documents. The following year, the government updated the policy, allowing gender change in identity cards without complete surgery, provided that the applicants comply with certain medical conditions, such as continuous hormonal treatment for at least two years and partial removal of sexual organs.

item.title: Chikungunya outbreak in Foshan already exceeds 2,500 cases
item.description: The health authorities of the city of Foshan, in the Chinese province of Guangdong (Southeast), are trying to contain a chikungunya fever outbreak that has already recorded 2,658 cases, all considered light, local media told yesterday. The outbreak was detected on July 8 through local surveillance systems, which led to the immediate activation of a response plan by municipal health authorities. Chikungunya fever is a viral disease caused by a homonymous virus, transmitted mainly by mosquitoes. The most common symptoms include high fever, intense joint pain, fatigue and rash. With a population of about 7.4 million inhabitants, Foshan designated 53 hospitals as treatment centers and made more than 3,600 beds with mosquitoes, according to state television CCTV. In addition, 35 hospitals in the city received authorization to perform specific PCR tests for virus detection. Suspected cases that result positively will be admitted to avoiding the spread of the outbreak. Increased infections occurs during heat and rainfall in southern China, conditions conducive to the proliferation of disease -transmitting mosquitoes. Prevention Following the spread of the virus in the southeast of the country, the seafood authorities of Beijing recommended this week the reinforcement of prevention measures and appealed to the population to reduce exposure to bites, through the use of skin -covering clothes, repellent application and elimination of larvae breeds. The incubation period of chikungunya fever usually varies between two and four days and may extend to a week. The disease manifests itself suddenly, with fever, joint inflammation and rash. The World Health Organization (WHO) appealed on Tuesday to adopt preventive measures to avoid large-scale outbreaks similar to those registered about 20 years ago on Indian Islands such as Mayotte, meeting or mauriousness, which eventually led to the spread of disease to neighboring countries such as Madagascar, Somalia or Kenya.

item.title: UNESCO | Beijing criticizes the departure of the US and questions that it is a responsible gesture
item.description: China yesterday criticized the US decision to abandon UNESCO, considering it unworthy of “a large and responsible country,” and called for a commitment to multilateralism and the principles of the United Nations Letter. "The United States has long accumulated payments overdue of their contributions as a member of UNESCO," said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun, lamenting Washington's new withdrawal announcement this week. "China has always supported UNESCO's work," said Guo, highlighting the organization's mission to "promote international cooperation in education, science and culture, strengthen the understanding between civilizations and safeguard world peace." In the context of the 80th anniversary of the United Nations Foundation, the diplomat appealed to all countries to “reaffirm their commitment to multilateralism” and support an international system with the UN in the center, “based on international law and the principles of the United Nations Letter”. Donald Trump's government has announced that the US will formally abandon UNESCO on December 31, 2026, claiming that the permanence in the organization "no longer serves national interests." Washington accuses the agency of promoting a “globalist agenda” and criticizes the decision to accept Palestine as a member state. The Popular Republic of China has been a member of UNESCO since 1971, the year of its entry into the UN, and currently occupies a seat on the agency's executive board (2021–2025). In recent years, China has become one of UNESCO's leading financial taxpayers and hosts several centers linked to the organization in the areas of education, heritage and science.

item.title: Japanese children join Portugal to protect the ocean
item.description: Dozens of Japanese children joined yesterday at Expo2025 in Osaka, an appeal to protect the seas, which the Lisbon Oceanarium wants to take the UN summit on climate change in November, Brazil. “Do you want to be ocean ambassadors here in Japan?” Asked at the Portugal Pavilion, Marine Biologist Natacha Moreira, from the Blue Ocean Foundation, to the students of two classes of an Osaka school. The positive response came in a unison chorus of 40 voices, the first Japanese young people to sign the mini 30x30, “a wave” launched by the blue ocean and the oceanarium, in support of the world's ocean -protecting 30 percent goal by 2030. The Oceanarian Director of Education, Diogo Geraldes, told Lusa that a first letter was delivered during the third UN conference, which Nice, France, in June. A new version of the document will be delivered to the United Nations Conference on Climate Change (COP30), which will take place in November in Belém, the state capital of Pará, northern Brazil. The appeal has already gathered the support of 9,500 young people from 27 countries, but in Asia still had contributions from Malaysian and Timor-Leste schools. The Oceanarium prepared materials on the Mini 30x30 in Japanese especially for Expo, which already existed in Portuguese, Spanish, French and English. Before they vote unanimously in favor of the appeal, the Japanese young people tested the interactive experiences of the Oceanarium in one of the two multi -arts of the Portugal Pavilion, whose theme is “Ocean: Blue Dialogue”. With history "The Lisbon Oceanarium is, in Portugal, the institution with more scrolls and experience in Blue Literacy. For over 25 years that has been teaching teachers and students to have a more sustainable relationship with the sea," Blue Ocean Executive Administrator Tiago Pitta and Cunha told Lusa. An experience that led the Oceanarium and the Blue Ocean, with the support of the Directorate-General for Education, to develop the Educar Program for a Blue Generation, which promotes ocean literacy among students from 6 to 10 years. Diogo Geraldes explained that they started in the first cycle because "it is easier to form teachers, who are often the same from the first to fourth year." For five years, the project has been training to 1,300 teachers in a pilot phase that took place in the municipalities of Albufeira, Cascais, Mafra, Moura, Nazaré, Peniche, Silves, Sintra and the Autonomous Region of the Azores. After the end of this phase, in May 2024, the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation decided to extend the program to all primary schools in the country and to include the ocean in the curriculum. Tiago Pitta and Cunha said the goal is to "educate the most conscious generation of the entire European Union regarding the connection of humans with the ocean." "We could, in the end, be a little, as the Nordicas went to the environment [terrestrial] from the 1970s, the Portuguese citizens would be for blue," explained the expert. Created in 2017 by the Francisco Manuel dos Santos Society, which includes in its heritage the Lisbon Oceanarium, the Blue Ocean is a non -profit entity, which aims to contribute to the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans.

item.title: MNE | China expresses the desire to reinforce partnership with EU before Cimeira
item.description: China yesterday expressed the intention of reinforcing the partnership with the European Union (EU), before the bilateral summit that takes place this week in Beijing, in a context marked by commercial tensions and geopolitical disputes. "The country hopes that the meeting with European leaders will send a positive signal to the international community that both parties are committed to strengthening their partnership and jointly defending multilateralism and open cooperation," said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun. The diplomat indicated that relations between China and EU cross “a crucial moment”, with “new opportunities and challenges”, and that the summit will serve to “reinforce strategic communication” and “deepen dialogue and cooperation” at a time of growing global instability. According to Guo, the bilateral relationship has produced “fruit results” over the last 50 years, both in the economic plan and in the creation of international cooperation mechanisms. Summit China-EU is held on Thursday in Beijing to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two parts. The participation of Chinese President XI Jinping, the President of the European Commission, Ursula Von Der Leyen, and the President of the European Council, António Costa. The latter said on Monday that the relationship between China and the EU has a "crucial" role globally and expressed its intention to discuss with the Chinese authorities all points on the common agenda. Brussels has already indicated that it will address topics such as access to the Chinese market, war in Ukraine, climate change and the situation in the Middle East.

item.title: Food Security | Approved Standard for School Meals
item.description:
Lead food poisoning of 200 children in a day care center in Tianshui led authorities to apply new standards of demand to school menus
China approved the first national regulation for school meals, aiming to reinforce food safety after lead poisoning of more than 200 children in a core in the west of the country, authorities announced. The new regulation, issued by the state administration for the regulation of the market and which will enter into force on December 1, establishes requirements for companies responsible for the preparation and distribution of food in primary schools, secondary and kindergartens across the country, said state television CCTV. The rules provide for the designation of a main guardian for food security in each center, personal exclusively dedicated to the management and supervision of this area, and the creation of a dynamic risk control mechanism, which includes daily safety revisions, weekly danger identification and monthly analysis meetings. Regarding the acquisition of raw materials, the text determines that products such as rice, flour and cooking oil should be purchased centrally and at specific points. All main ingredients will also have to be submitted at least once a year to complete analyzes, including tests to the presence of pesticide waste. Food preparation should allow the monitoring, in real time, by schools, parents and students, the main steps of the process, through proper technology. Samples from each daily meal should be kept for a minimum of 48 hours. Improper for consumption The publication of the new standard occurs in a context of growing public concern with food in school establishments. Earlier this month, eight people were arrested as a result of leading lead poisoning that affected 233 children in a private day care in the city of Tianshui, western China. Those responsible for the establishment will have authorized the use of inappropriate substances for human consumption in the making of meals served to children. According to the authorities, the nursery kitchen used bought "online" dyes that contained lead and were labeled with warnings that they should not be ingested. Of the 251 children enrolled in the Center, 233 had abnormal levels of blood lead and 201 were hospitalized after symptoms such as nausea, diarrhea, leg pain or abdominal cramps, according to reports from parents cited by the local press. Food security has been a sensitive theme in China for decades, after several scandals that have shaken the population's confidence in quality control systems. One of the most serious cases occurred in 2008, with the contamination of milk with melamine, which caused the death of at least six babies and affected about 300,000 children.

item.title: Gaza | Pope asks for abbas help and protection of sacred places
item.description: The Pope asked yesterday "the proper entry of humanitarian aid" in Gaza "urgently", in a call with the president of the Palestinian authority in which he stressed "the obligation to protect the population and the sacred places." "Given the dramatic humanitarian situation, the urgency to assist those most exposed to the consequences of the conflict and allow the proper entry of humanitarian aid," said the Vatican, quoting Leo XIV. The Pontiff also renewed “its appeal to full respect for international humanitarian law” and emphasized “the obligation to protect civilians and sacred places”, as well as “the prohibition of indiscriminate use of force and forced population displacement”. In the telephone conversation, the two leaders discussed "the recent developments of the gaza range and violence in the West Bank." On Sunday, during the Angelus prayer, the Pope again manifested against violence in the Middle East after the Israeli attack last Thursday to the Parish of the Holy Family, the only Catholic Church in Gaza, which caused three dead and several wounded. The day after the attack, Leo XIV received a call from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, in which the Pope asked for a ceasefire and the end of the war in Gaza, as well as the protection of places of worship and the faithful. During his conversation with Abbas, the Pope also recalled the 10th anniversary of the comprehensive agreement between the Holy See and the State of Palestine, signed on June 26, 2015 and which came into force on January 2, 2016. The agreement, signed with the organization for the Liberation of Palestine (PLO), determines the formal recognition of the State of Palestine by the Holy See and, among other aspects, underlines the need for protection of holy Christian places in Palestine.

item.title: Jeju Air | Pilots shut down wrong engine, according to a report
item.description: Pilots of the Korean Jeju Air aircraft that had an accident in December last year will have been mistaken, the least damaged engine after the impact with a bird, yesterday indicated a source close to the investigation. According to the Korea Joongang Daily newspaper, the source said that the collected elements, including the voice recording of the cabin, computer data and a physical switch of the engine found between the wreckage, show that the riders turn off the left engine instead of the right to take emergency measurements after the impact with the bird, occurring moments before the expected landing. The investigation team, added the source, has “clear evidence” and has reached a conclusion, even though the official report was not disclosed due to protests by relatives of the victims. The investigation to the accident in Muan (southwest of South Korea) has already revealed that Jeju Air, as part of its efforts to maximize the operational profitability of its aircraft, reduces to the legal minimum of maintenance reviews before each flight. The rugged plane, a Boeing 737-800, was hit by a bird and eventually landed without acting the landing train or other braking systems, leaving the track and colliding with a wall at Muan airport. In the accident of December 29, 2024 179 passengers and members of the crew died, and there were two survivors. The accident was the most serious civil aviation disaster that occurred on South Korean soil and the worst of the year worldwide.

item.title: Japan | PM remains in office despite an electoral “hard blow”
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said yesterday that he will remain in power after the party that presides over losing the majority in the upper House of Parliament in Sunday elections in a new political setback. "We continue to be the party with the greatest representation. Despite the hard blow and the many difficulties, many people supported us strongly," Ishiba said at a press conference, stating that the decision to stay in office is due to the global political situation and the "difficult conditions" that the country is going through. In this sense, the leader highlighted the imposition of customs tariffs on the United States, inflation and fear that a strong earthquake or a natural catastrophe can reach the country at some point. The Democratic Liberal Party (PLD) of Ishiba and coalition partner, Komeito, who needed to win 50 seats, in addition to the 75 they already have to keep the majority, they got 47. There were three places left for most and there was a 19 -seat retreat from what they had before the elections. The defeat is another blow to the Ishiba coalition, making it a minority in both chambers, after the defeat in October in the Baixa Chamber elections, and aggravating Japan's political instability. It was the first time the PLD-led coalition has lost the majority in both parliament chambers since party formation in 1955. Up and down Asked about the possibility of widening the coalition to other opposition parties, Ishiba said it had no intention of doing so at this time and stated that the PLD "must be responsible and develop policies." The official also excluded the possibility of government remodeling. "We will seriously consult the other parties and talk about responsibility and continue with the policies in terms of tariffs and catastrophes," he added. Among the opposition parties, the Left Liberal Constitutional Democratic Party (CDP) was in second place with 22 places, while the Popular Democratic Party (PDP) reformist was third with 17. The surprise was the Japanese nationalist party of far right Sanseito, who, under the motto "Japan first", emerged as one of the great winners of Sunday elections, winning 14 seats and becoming the third largest opposition party.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries
item.description:
In an interview with Lusa agency, the secretary general of the Macau Forum, Ji Xianzheng, assured that “never discussed” the widening of action to Hispanic countries, but that to realize the will already stated by the government of Sam Hou Fai will have to be the authorities to decide a new direction to the cooperation strategy
The Secretary-General of the Macau Forum stated that the institution “never discussed” the creation of an entity to extend to Hispanic countries to promote economic cooperation similar to those that provide the connection between China and Portuguese-speaking countries. “Within the Macao Forum, we have never discussed this topic,” said the Forum Secretary-General for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries Ji Xianzheng. The official acknowledged that, "in society, there were some conversations to discuss or address the possibility of promoting more contact and cooperation with Spanish -language countries, but at the Forum level we have never addressed this theme." The Macao executive announced in mid -April the intention of creating a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in Hispanic countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with norms, formation, arbitration and mediation”, according to the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong. Days earlier, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, had also announced the intention of “promoting exchange and cooperation” through Macao between China and the universe of Spanish -speaking countries. Although Macau wants to widen focus to Castilian -speaking countries, “the forum will remain the forum for China and Lusophony countries,” said Ji Xianzheng. The secretary general clarified that the institution that directs "can contribute contributions to the greater opening of Macao in international cooperation", as is the intention announced by the new government of MSAR. Complementary forum Personally, the secretary-general guaranteed to have "all the pleasure of working with all parties," but stressed that this is a "decision that is up to the central governments to make" and that the forum was never contacted in this regard. "Yes, I worked in Latin America, Spain, nine years in Madrid and Caracas. But this is not a decision of personal interest, it is up to politicians to make the decision," he said, explaining that the idea will be to promote the relationship between Macao and Brazil and then to other Latin American countries, as well as expanding the relationship with Portugal to Spain. "There is no limit. The Macao Forum is complementary. It does not restrict any promotion of the cooperation of the other parts," he said. According to the Macao Government Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai admitted on June 21 that he postponed a trip to Portugal, scheduled for July, and should also pass through Spain and the European Union headquarters in Brussels. Bad interpretations In the same interview with Lusa, the secretary general of the Macao Forum imputed to national governments the responsibility for conducting economic development and cooperation policies, stressing that the institution “has no investment projects”. Ji Xianzheng attributes criticism to the Macao Forum to an wrong interpretation regarding the body's mission. "The forum is a mechanism of cooperation between central governments. Many people think it is to the secretariat that it is up to the execution of policies, but we have a limited number of people," added Ji. "The secretariat has no investment projects, it is a mechanism for preparing the ministerial conference, connecting with governments, not a promotion agency. It has not been thought of, connects with the promotion agencies. We are four people sent by China and one delegate for each country," he said. At the last ministerial conference, in April 2024, then Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis argued that the Portuguese Language China-Parais Cooperation and Development Fund should bet more on small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The Cooperation Fund was created in 2013 by the China Development Bank and the Macao Industrial and Commercial Development Fund, with a thousand million dollars, of which about 60 percent have already been invested, according to the secretary general. Action plans Ji Xianzheng has admitted that SMEs are "a difficult theme for any government" and that "international cooperation for the promotion of development and cooperation of small and medium enterprises is even more difficult. It is a theme that is being debated in the world worldwide." But admitted, "here, little." "But it is stipulated in the action plan [2024-2026]. It is up to central governments and commerce chambers, promotion agents, to work together to do this. The secretariat assumes responsibility as authorized by the central governments, specifically, in the activities program," he said. Politicians from various countries, including Portugal, Angola and Mozambique, have appealed to a change in the rules of the fund's candidacy.
